intro: Galeandra bouliawongo, commonly known as the Bouliawongo orchid, is a rare and specialized orchid species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has linear, grass-like leaves and produces inflorescences with clustered, showy blooms. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and requires well-drained, nutrient-rich soil. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
